clinical_study.brief_title: A Comparison of the Outcomes of Distal Fingertip Amputations Treated With Either Artificial (Xeroform) or Biological Dressings
clinical_study.official_title: A Comparison of the Outcomes of Distal Fingertip Amputations Treated With Either Artificial (Xeroform) or Biological Dressings

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective study looking to evaluate whether the treatment outcomes for patients who sustain a distal fingertip amputation are improved or no different when using biological dressings versus artificial dressings.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to complete healing up to 3 Months
Percentage of graft viability (for biological dressing only)

arm_group.description: Bacitracin will be applied and covered with xeroform and gauze
the amputated composite skin and soft tissue unit will be thinned out to become a full thickness skin graft

intervention.description: For the first 30 people, bacitracin will be applied and covered with xeroform and gauze.
For the next 30 patients, the amputated composite skin and soft tissue unit will be thinned out to become a full thickness skin graft.

study_pop.textblock: 60 patients will be followed for the study. The first 30 patients will be treated with biological dressings and subsequent 30 patients will be treated with artificial dressings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All individuals presenting at Bellevue Hospital for evaluation and treatment of a finger amputation distal to the germinal matrix that present along with the amputated distal fingertip unit.
Exclusion Criteria:
- replantation candidate, incomplete distal finger-tip amputation
